meanings.definition: A handle or arm that is turned to operate a machine or device.
meanings.sent1: She turned the crank to start the old-fashioned car.
meanings.sent2: The crank on the music box played a sweet melody.
meanings.sent3: The crank on the well seemed to have a mind of its own, splashing water everywhere.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked like a rusty crank, slowly churning out ideas.
meanings.sent5: The crank on the toy windmill spun wildly in the breeze.

meanings.definition: A person who holds eccentric or unconventional beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The old man down the street is known as the neighborhood crank.
meanings.sent2: She dismissed him as just another crank with wild theories.
meanings.sent3: The crank at the town meeting always had a unique perspective on things.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were like those of a crank, spinning in their own strange orbit.
meanings.sent5: The crank's latest conspiracy theory had everyone talking.

meanings.definition: To turn a handle or arm in order to operate a machine or device.
meanings.sent1: He had to crank the engine several times before it finally started.
meanings.sent2: She cranked the handle of the ice cream maker until the mixture was thick.
meanings.sent3: The old gramophone needed a good crank to play the music.
meanings.sent4: She cranked up the volume on the radio to hear the news better.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic cranked the lever to lift the heavy machinery.
